thread.title: David Lee, Jae Crowder start again as Boston Celtics keep same first unit against Real Madrid
thread.title_full: David Lee, Jae Crowder start again as Boston Celtics keep same first unit against Real Madrid

author: Jay King | mjking@masslive.com
title: David Lee, Jae Crowder start again as Boston Celtics keep same first unit against Real Madrid
text:
David Lee, Jae Crowder start again as Boston Celtics keep same first unit against Real Madrid Italy Basketball Celtics Boston Celtics' David Lee, left, drives as Olimpia Milano's Robbie Hummel challenges him, during their basketball match, part of the NBA global games, in Assago, near Milan, Italy, Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015. (AP Photo/Antonio Calanni) 
After drubbing Olimpia Milano in a preseason opener earlier this week, Boston Celtics head coach Brad Stevens will stick with the same starting lineup against Real Madrid. Marcus Smart, Avery Bradley, Jae Crowder, David Lee and Tyler Zeller will start tonight for the Celtics. â€” Boston Celtics (@celtics) October 8, 2015 
Stevens had earlier considered experimenting with the first unit. Injuries and sickness could be factors as Evan Turner (a starter from last season) and Amir Johnson (the biggest free-agent acquisition) will both miss the game. Perry Jones is also out due to a death in his family. 
But again, Stevens will go with three guys who started last season (Smart, Bradley and Zeller), allowing most of the powerful bench to stay intact. When super sixth man Isaiah Thomas isn't on the court, the Celtics could want to run a lot of offense through Lee. Stevens has stressed how much he appreciates the big man's playmaking. 
Stevens could still shake things up, of course, as Boston's roster has very little separation almost from top to bottom. But his rotation should start to emerge as the preseason continues, and might be forming already.
